data.title: "In any case, let's eat breakfast." Isaac Bashevis Singer said these words to his wife on hearing that he had ben awarded the 1978 Nobel...
data.meta_description:
2,385 likes, 20 comments - nobelprize_org on October 29, 2022: ""In any case, let's eat breakfast."

Isaac Bashevis Singer said these words to his wife on hearing that he had ben awarded the 1978 Nobel Prize in Literature.

Singer was awarded the prize â€œfor his impassioned narrative art which, with roots in a Polish-Jewish cultural tradition, brings universal human conditions to life." Singer wrote his works in Yiddish and crossed several generations of protagonists. Singer's work often explored how modernity, secularism, and assimilation affect families. His books often featured Jewish folklore and legends in his works. 

In addition to his novels, Singer also wrote books for children and wrote an autobiography. 

What would you say upon learning that you had been awarded a Nobel Prize?".
